content: Yes, some feminist theologians have argued that Mary Magdalene might have been a more significant figure in early Christianity than previously thought. They point out that Mary Magdalene was the first witness to the resurrection of Jesus and that she played an important role in spreading the good news of the gospel. Some also argue that Mary Magdalene may have been one of the apostles or even a leader of an early Christian community. This perspective challenges the traditional view that Mary Magdalene was a repentant prostitute and a minor character in the New Testament.
